item.title: 沃尔玛山姆会员店将从 11 月起为 10 万名员工提高时薪
item.description: 沃尔玛旗下的山姆会员店（Sam's Club）周二表示，将提高近 10 万名员工的平均时薪，作为新员工补偿计划的一部分，该计划将在假日旺季到来之前生效。【原文：Walmart-owned Sam's Club said on Tuesday it would raise average hourly wages for nearly 100,000 of its workers, as part of a new employee compensation plan that will come into effect ahead of the holiday season rush.】

item.title: 雪佛龙首席执行官抨击拜登的天然气政策，称燃料对人工智能至关重要
item.description: 雪佛龙公司首席执行官迈克尔-沃思（Michael Wirth）周二批评了美国总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）政府所谓的 "对天然气 "行业的 "攻击"，并强调了二叠纪天然气在推动人工智能（AI）快速发展方面的关键作用。【原文：Chevron CEO Michael Wirth on Tuesday criticized U.S. President Joe Biden's administration for what he described as "attacks on the natural gas” industry and emphasized the crucial role of Permian natural gas in powering the rapid growth of artificial intelligence (AI).】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，摩根大通正与苹果洽谈接管其信用卡项目事宜
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二报道，摩根大通正在与苹果公司商谈从高盛集团手中接管这家科技巨头的信用卡项目。【原文：JPMorgan Chase is talking with Apple about taking over the tech giant's credit-card program from Goldman Sachs , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国监管机构就客户同意收取透支费问题向银行发出警告
item.description: 美国消费者金融最高监管机构周二发布法律指南，称这将有助于阻止银行向未真正同意透支的客户收取透支费。【原文：The top U.S. regulator for consumer finance on Tuesday published legal guidance that it said would help stop banks from charging overdraft fees to customers who had not genuinely consented to the practice.】

item.title: Chinese insurance broker Yuanbao files for US IPO amid reviving investor appetite
item.description: Chinese insurance broker Yuanbao on Tuesday filed for an initial public offering in the United States, signaling a broader recovery in investor appetite for new listings.

item.title: AT&T to pay $13 million over 2023 customer data breach
item.description: AT&T has agreed to pay $13 million to resolve an investigation over a data breach of a cloud vendor in January 2023 that impacted 8.9 million AT&T customers, the Federal Communications Commission said Tuesday.

item.title: Uber to roll out 'verified' rider badge, trip recording features in US
item.description: Uber is rolling out features that would allow its drivers to see "verified" badges on customer profiles and record trips on their smartphones instead of a dashcam, the ride-hailing firm said on Tuesday.

item.title: US business inventories rise slightly above expectations in July
item.description: U.S. business inventories increased slightly more than expected in July, suggesting that inventory investment could contribute to economic growth in the third quarter.

item.title: US regulator to propose strengthened rules for banks working with fintechs
item.description: A top U.S. banking regulator is set to propose that banks bolster recordkeeping requirements for accounts held by fintech companies on behalf of their customers, following the collapse of bank-fintech middleman Synapse Financial Technologies earlier this year, which led to the freezing of thousands of accounts.

item.title: US home builder confidence edges up as rate cut looms
item.description: U.S. home builder confidence edged up in September as mortgage rates fell, breaking four months of consecutive declines, but remained at relatively low levels as rising costs continued to impede construction.

item.title: Fed to go big on first rate cut, traders bet
item.description: Traders on Tuesday kept bets the Federal Reserve will start an expected series of interest rate cuts with a half-percentage-point move downward on Wednesday, an expectation that may itself put pressure on central bankers to deliver just that.

item.title: US manufacturing output rebounds in August
item.description: Production at U.S. factories surged in August amid a rebound in motor vehicle output, but data for the prior month was revised lower, suggesting that manufacturing continued to tread water.

item.title: US SEC fines 12 municipal advisors for recordkeeping violations
item.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday fined 12 municipal advisors more than $1.3 million to settle civil charges that they failed to preserve electronic communications such as text messages.

item.title: Philip Morris to sell stake in pharma unit Vectura for $198 mln
item.description: Marlboro maker Philip Morris International's unit Vectura Fertin Pharma said on Tuesday it would sell its subsidiary Vectura Group to Molex Asia Holdings for 150 million pounds ($198.09 million).

item.title: Truckmakers say they are ready to go electric, but what about charging?
item.description: Major manufacturers, such as Daimler Truck and Traton , displaying their trucks at a transportation fair in Hanover this week say they are ready to go electric, but their e-trucks will not sell without massive investments in charging infrastructure.

item.title: VIEW Canada's inflation cools to 2% in Aug, reaches central bank's target
item.description: Canada's annual inflation rate reached the central bank's target in August as it cooled to 2%, its lowest level since February 2021, data showed on Tuesday.

item.title: Judge rules for ARC Global in breach of contract claim against Trump Media
item.description: A Delaware judge ruled for Patrick Orlando's ARC Global on a breach of contract claim over its stake in Trump Media & Technology Group , although the judge rejected ARC's breach of fiduciary claim, according to an opinion published on Tuesday.

item.title: EVs could reach 24% EU car market share by 2025, T&E says
item.description: Battery-electric cars (BEVs) sold in the European Union are set to reach a total market share of between 20% and 24% by 2025, mostly because of cheaper selling prices, campaign group Transport & Environment (T&E) said on Tuesday.

item.title: Google takes Chile data center plans back to square one on environmental concerns
item.description: Google will rework from scratch its plans to build a $200 million data center in Santiago after concerns were raised about its environmental impact on the Chilean capital, the U.S. tech giant said in a statement on Tuesday.

item.title: US retail sales unexpectedly rise in August
item.description: U.S. retail sales unexpectedly rose in August, suggesting that the economy remained on a solid footing through much of the third quarter.

item.title: Canada's inflation cools to 2% in Aug, reaches central bank's target
item.description: Canada's annual inflation rate reached the central bank's target in August at it cooled to 2%, its lowest level since February 2021, data showed on Tuesday.

item.title: UniCredit to seek ECB approval to potentially buy up to 30% of Commerzbank, sources say
item.description: UniCredit will seek ECB clearance to potentially buy up to 30% of Commerzbank , three people close to the matter said, in order to have the "flexibility" the Italian bank's CEO Andrea Orcel said he needs to plan his next move.

item.title: Canadian housing starts tumble 22% in August
item.description: Canadian housing starts dropped 22% in August compared with the previous month as groundbreaking decreased on multiple-unit urban homes, data from the national housing agency showed on Tuesday.

item.title: Embraer's Eve taps former Rolls-Royce executive as chief commercial officer
item.description: Electric aircraft maker Eve has appointed former Rolls-Royce executive Megha Bhatia as its new chief commercial officer, the company said on Tuesday, as it continues to develop its "flying taxi".

item.title: Over-priced Fed rate cuts make T-bills unattractive, Federated Hermes says
item.description: Market expectations of substantial U.S. rate cuts this year are making short-dated debt unattractive as the Federal Reserve is unlikely to be as aggressive in easing monetary policy, said Deborah Cunningham, a money market fund manager for Federated Hermes, on Tuesday.

item.title: Intel's Amazon chip deal lifts investor confidence in money-losing foundry unit
item.description: Intel shares jumped 7% before the bell on Tuesday, as a chip-making deal with Amazon's cloud business provided a major stamp of approval for its struggling contract manufacturing business.

item.title: Most brokerages expect 25 bps rate cut from Fed on Wednesday
item.description: Major brokerages expect the U.S. Federal Reserve to lower interest rates by 25 basis points at the end of its two-day monetary policy meeting that starts on Tuesday, even as financial markets price in a good chance of policymakers starting the easing cycle with an outsized rate reduction.

item.title: Stellantis working hard to avoid Volkswagen plant closure scenario, CEO says
item.description: Stellantis has already taken measures and is working hard to avoid the risk of plant closures facing rival Volkswagen , the carmaker's CEO Carlos Tavares said on Tuesday.

item.title: Ryanair seeing better momentum in bookings, less need to discount, CEO says
item.description: Ryanair Group has seen better momentum in bookings since August and less need to discount prices, CEO Michael O'Leary said in an interview on Tuesday.

item.title: Instagram rolls out teen account with privacy, parental controls as scrutiny mounts
item.description: Meta Platforms is rolling out special accounts with new privacy settings for teenaged Instagram users, it said on Tuesday, its latest effort to limit their exposure to harmful content on its apps amid regulatory pressure.
